string.text: Can I ask you something?
Sure, what would you like to know?
What can you tell me about this area?

There is an old military installation not far from here, not a lot there now except mutants and zombies, and Kopachi Village to the north of it. Well, it's not much of a village - just a few mounds, really. It was buried back in 86 to prevent it from emitting radiation. People don't go there much, it's not a healthy place and there's nothing of value there. Then there's the scientist's bunker that was airlifted in to the southwest of here.
Tell me about the people who live in the bunker.

They're a small group of researchers led by two scientists, Hermann and Ozersky. Hermann is the boss around there - he's a professor from some institute, probably a secret one. He organized the expedition, so they dropped this bunker in here almost immediately. Ozersky's the number two around there, he's a good, friendly fella. I don't know much more about him - Hermann is the one we deal with most of the time.
What's your story?

I'm a big game hunter, and the Zone has some of the biggest. I came to the north with a friend of mine on safari, we hunted for trophies and eliminated mutants that were a danger to the local stalkers. Nowadays, I mainly just organize the hunts for younger stalkers. I train them and teach them hunting tactics.
Why don't you hunt anymore?

I’m getting old, man. That’s why my friend Fox died. We hunted many a beast together, shoulder to shoulder, then we ran into these two Chimeras that have never been seen in the Zone before. One knocked Fox to the ground and eviscerated him before I could even get my shotgun out. I wounded the other one, but they ran off. They're still out there somewhere, I hope they burn in hell forever!
Tell me about hunting mutants.
Different mutants require different approaches, Burers and Poltergeists require one, Pseudogiants and Controllers need another. Then you got Chimeras, which are a real special case.
Tell me about Burers.

Burers use gravitation attacks. When at close range they'll throw you, and when they're far away they'll try to throw something at you. Your best bet is to keep them at a medium range from you and keep moving, unless you enjoy getting hit by something heavy. Be careful to conserve your energy, though! Burers can use directed gravitational impulses to try to yank your weapon out of your hands, and if you're tired it might just work.
Tell me about Poltergeists.

There are two types of Poltergeists. The first type sends items crashing into the enemy using gravitation, while the second type uses flames to burn its victims. Inexperienced hunters try to circle around them to evade their attacks. The trick is to know that Poltergeists can't see or hear, in the usual sense of those words, instead they sense objects that move in the gravitational field. Use that to your advantage. A seasoned hunter knows to freeze as soon as he sees a Poltergeist.
Tell me about Controllers.

They use your own mind against you. When you're hunting a Controller it's important to use cover. They must be able to see you in order to affect your mind. They're quite slow, so if your life is at stake, use grenades.
Tell me about Chimeras.

They're very dangerous nocturnal predators. They try to get behind you under cover of darkness and leap on top of you. If you know there's a Chimera around, keep checking your back and cover your friends' asses.
Tell me about Pseudogiants.

The most difficult thing about hunting Pseudogiants is killing them. They can take incredible punishment without so much as batting an eyelid. All I can say is that you may want to try using a shotgun at close range. Just remember that Pseudogiant attacks can obliterate anything that isn't bolted down. Attack it from above, and make sure that whatever you're standing on can withstand some damage.
What do you do here?
We research various phenomena. Are you interested in something specific?
What is the purpose of your research?

We have no specific objective in mind. We're scientific scouts, if you will. We are seeking to identify correlations in certain phenomena, develop new theories, and make new discoveries. We are trying to find a logical explanation for the unexplained things we see in the Zone. If we can uncover the secrets behind even ten percent of the phenomena we see here, we could advance global technological development by decades.
What do you know about the Zone?

I can only hypothesize at this stage, we're far from understanding the Zone as a system. I believe that the Zone was formed as a consequence of some new force. Electromagnetic fields, physical force, and radiation couldn't have changed the biosphere so quickly. Obviously, some mutations can be explained by radiation, but excuse me, an ordinary pig would need hundreds - if not thousands - of years to mutate into a Flesh! In the Zone the mutation occurred in just a couple of years. It's as if someone directly altered the genetic information in the individual animals. The thought of that is enough to send shivers down my spine.
What can you tell me about anomalies?

As you approach an anomaly, keep in mind that it's going to be either very hot, or the air will be full of toxic gases, or it will be a radiation hot-spot. There can also be psi disruptions, but I won't go into those right now. It depends on the nature of the anomaly; be it heat, gas, electricity, or gravity. There are also moving anomalies, but that's a different kettle of fish altogether.
Tell me about heat anomalies.

If you see a sort of glimmering, like air steaming over pavement on a hot summer day, that's a heat anomaly. When something gets in it, that spot bursts into an extremely hot flame. At first it was thought those were jets of natural gas, but that theory has since fallen into obscurity.
Tell me about gas anomalies.

This type of anomaly is a strange, never-ending chemical process. They produce acids that eat your skin in a matter of seconds, as well as toxic gases that eat your lungs just as fast. Thankfully, gas anomalies are easy to spot out in the open. Just hope you don't walk into one in a dark tunnel.
Tell me about electrical anomalies.

A very interesting type of anomaly which accumulates a substantial amount of static electricity. Stalkers usually take advantage of the fact that an electrical anomaly can be discharged with any metallic item. They throw a bolt in and dash right through before it charges up again. I prefer to go around. The recharge phase is just too quick.
Tell me about gravitational anomalies.

They are typically stationary. When you look at a particular spot and notice that objects are distorted behind it you've got one, and you better keep your distance. All three known varieties react instantly, the moment something touches them. Springboards explode anything that wanders into one. Vortexes do the opposite; they suck an object in, crushing it with terrible pressure, only to send the bits flying seconds after. Whirligigs lift their victims into the air, spin them around and tear them to shreds. An unpleasant end, whichever way you go.
Tell me about moving anomalies.

Personally I've only come across a Comet and a Tesla. The former is a fireball about three feet in diameter; but I assure you, you'll feel the heat from a much greater distance. The latter is, for lack of a better description, a ball of lightning. It's definitely a ball and it's definitely electrical in nature. Both anomalies always keep moving, but usually in closed-loop paths. A careful stalker should be able to easily go around them. Just don't lose your focus.
What can I sell you today?
Hello stalker, what do you need?
I'm Trapper... There's no need to introduce yourself.
What brings you here?
You looking for medical supplies or just here for a chat?
I need medical assistance.
Let's have a look...
Let's have a look... Well, your liver is bigger than I'd expect, but that's an occupational hazard, right? Apart from that, you're as healthy as a Burer.
Okay.
That's better.
So, what have you got to say?
What's your business here?
Tell me about your group.
It's a long story. What do you want to know?
What is it that you do here?

We're making sure that various officials don't conceal anything from the common folk. You know how it is; as soon as they find a new lab or some documents that shed light on the secrets of the Zone, they immediately organize a military operation and clean everything up better than a friggin' hoover. The only way of finding shit out is by getting there first.
What brought you to the center of the Zone?

We were an expedition force dispatched by Freedom to push north, further into the Zone. We were one of the first groups of stalkers to reach this far north, or so we thought. We ran across some Dutiers up here and had a bit of a scrap with them, but called a truce when a blowout came. Then somehow the Brain Scorcher got switched back on and we all found ourselves trapped up here. The poor bastards from Duty all died out since then, and we haven't been fairing much better either. It's not all bad though, it's an opportunity to find stuff that the world hasn't seen before. Neither the army nor stalkers have been here before, so there's something new everywhere you look.
Did you find anything?
A couple of locked doors and some weird new artefacts.
How did you end up in Freedom?

I was friends with Freedom leaders back when there was no Zone. Mind you, in those days they weren't leaders, they were regular hippies. So when I made a move into the Zone in search of artefacts and ran into familiar faces, I figured I might as well go with what I know.
What do you think about Duty?

They're idiots, that's what I think. I mean, why the hell would they want to destroy the Zone? It's not consuming precious resources or getting bigger... or anything. They could just sit there and study it to their heart's content - just think of how many scientific discoveries could be made... I mean, in the history of man-kind, no one has never been able to understand anti-gravitation, right? And in the Zone you've got ready-made anti-gravitation devices lying all over the place. It wouldn't hurt to kick their asses out of here, but it's too much hassle. By the way, don't be confused by our relations here at Yanov. We are at war... it's just that Yanov has been made neutral territory, if you know what I mean.
Okay, forget about it.
No problem.
Welcome to my humble abode of pleasure and joy. You after joy, pleasure or both in equal measure?
You come to chill? My drinks ain't nothing special but this is a welcoming and friendly place!
I got all the shit you're ever gonna need. What are you after? You fancy some chow, a drink or feel like firing off a few rounds?
What would you like to say to me?
What brings you here?
What brings you here?
You go tell %s to get his fat ass over here.
Doesn't he know I'm busy? Tell him to come over here.
I don't get paid for walking. Tell him to come to me.
What? Does he want a wheelchair? Go fetch %s for me.
Where is %s? I can't fix it until he brings it here.
If %s wants it, tell him to come over here and take it from me.
Come again? If he wants it, he comes and gets it. Okay?
You tell that balding bastard to drag himself over here.
I cannot leave my shop alone. He must come to me, 'eh?
Do I look like an errand boy? Tell %s to get it himself.
